title: Existence of positive solution for a nonlinear problem with mixed conditions
abstract: In this work, we prove the existence of a positive solution to the second-order nonlinear problem $u''+f(t,u,u')=0$ with mixed boundary conditions, where $f$ is an $L^p$-Carath√©odory function satisfying certain properties. Three boundary conditions are analyzed. The proofs of the results are based on the Mawhin's. coincidence degree.
comment: 19 pages. arXiv admin note: text overlap with arXiv:1503.04954 by other authors
